dmca.title: There's a Thorn in the Copyright
dmca.body:
30 June 2011

Internet Brands, Inc. 
Legal Affairs Department, DMCA Complaint 
909 N. Sepulveda Blvd., 11th Floor 
El Segundo, CA 90245 USA 
(310) 280-5369, Attn: Legal Affairs Dept., DMCA Complaint

ATTN:  Legal Affairs Department

To whom it may concern:

My name is [Sender].  A Web site that your company hosts is infringing on a copyright owned by myself.  An image was cropped to remove a copyright notice and was then used in an article on your site by the user [Username] without permission.  The original photo, to which I own the exclusive copyrights, can be found at:

   http://www.hort.net/profile/ros/rosru/main.jpg 

and is visible on a hort.net page (which has permission) at 

   http://www.hort.net/profile/ros/rosru/

The unauthorized and infringing copy can be found at:

   http://pics.davesgarden.com/pics/2007/11/18/paulgrow/57b2bf.jpg

and is visible at the bottom of the page at

   http://davesgarden.com/guides/articles/view/298/

This letter is official notification under Section 512(c) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act (”DMCA”), and I seek the removal of the aforementioned infringing material from your servers. I request that you immediately notify the infringer of this notice and inform them of their duty to remove the infringing material immediately, and notify them to cease any further posting of infringing material to your server in the future.

Please also be advised that law requires you, as a service provider, to remove or disable access to the infringing materials upon receiving this notice. Under US law a service provider, such as yourself, enjoys immunity from a copyright lawsuit provided that you act with deliberate speed to investigate and rectify ongoing copyright infringement. If service providers do not investigate and remove or disable the infringing material this immunity is lost. Therefore, in order for you to remain immune from a copyright infringement action you will need to investigate and ultimately remove or otherwise disable the infringing material from your servers with all due speed should the direct infringer, your client, not comply immediately.

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above as allegedly infringing is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law. I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner, or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Should you wish to discuss this with me please contact me directly.

Thank you for your time and attention,



[Sender]
[Sender Address]
[Sender Email]
